Sentencas: Pulsed laser deposition (PLD) has been used to prepare two types of superionic ceramic thin films: (i) NASICON (Na superionic conductor) for a Na ion selective membrane and (ii) the mixed electronic and oxygen conductors La(1-x)Sr(x)MnO(3+/-delta) (LSM) for the cathode in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Pulsed laser deposition of superionic ceramic thin films: deposition and applications in electrochemistry

Sentencas: NASICON thin films have good ionic conductivity with resistivities between 3 x 10(3) and 5 x 10(4) Omega cm at room temperature and they have low surface particle densities depending upon the deposition conditions.
Titulo: Pulsed laser deposition of superionic ceramic thin films: deposition and applications in electrochemistry

Sentencas: When NASICON is deposited on polymeric (Raipore) membranes frequently employed for Na selectivity, the composite membranes show a significant increase of current efficiency of 23% for the production of sodium hydroxide from sodium sulfate using electrolysis.
Titulo: Pulsed laser deposition of superionic ceramic thin films: deposition and applications in electrochemistry

Sentencas: For LSM, very smooth and dense thin films are produced by PLD with the perovskite structure after an anneal at 950 degrees C. (C) 1998
Titulo: Pulsed laser deposition of superionic ceramic thin films: deposition and applications in electrochemistry
Pulsed laser deposition of superionic ceramic thin films: deposition and applications in electrochemistry
